name: Kalaekilohana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a first class B&B run by two amazingly generous individuals, Kilohana and Kenny. The property is spacious and luxurious. The breakfasts and dinners are some of the best food in the entire state of Hawaii. Best of all it is in a serene, tranquil setting that will make you feel absolutely refreshed. Other highlights include the free beverages and snacks all day and the close location to the green sand and black sand beaches that will let you beat the crowds without a ridiculously early start.
reviews.title: Amazing, Relaxing Property with Delicious Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were warmly greeted by the innkeepers as though we were family. We found the rooms to be spacious, professionally and comfortably appointed, tastefully decorated and cozy. The native hawaiian eucalyptus wood floors and moldings created a regal elegance. Our room overlooked the expansive front lawn full of cardinals and pretty little bright yellow birds. The highlight of our visit was the meals. Kenny and Kilohana created the most tasty breakfasts and dinners. Homemade breakfast sausage, homemade icecream... buckwheat pancakes, french press kona coffee, yum! They even graciously accommodated my gluten free needs. Complimentary wine and beer in the evenings topped off a wonderful stay. Thank you.
reviews.title: Aloha at it's finest!

reviews.text: Excellent experience. Perfect if you want a quiet, peaceful vacation. Kenny and Kilohana were excellent hosts. Always available to answer our questions, provide suggestions on activities in the area, check on our comfort, get what we needed, etc. We felt like we got a true personal Hawaiian experience here (not the tourist version at a chain hotel).
reviews.title: Wonderful True Hawaiian Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible breakfast every morning - focusing on local food. Kenny would tell us about each breakfast item. We had dinner one night that was incredible. They plan to begin offering dinner a couple nights a week soon - definitely eat here if you can.
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have a hard time finding rooms with enough beds for our family of 4 - with 2 teenagers (girl & boy); we want 3 beds. The rooms here (4 total) definitely fit our needs. Beds were very comfortable. Furniture and décor throughout the home were very nice. This house was built to be a bed and breakfast and the layout is great. Each room has nice private bathroom.
reviews.title: The HOSPITALITY have a sense

description: Experience an award-winning luxury bed and breakfast. Kalaekilohana is an architectural landmark and one of Hawaii's premier inns. Perfectly located for touring the southern half of Hawaii Island, from Volcano to South Kona.
